vulnerability_findings.name: non-payable-constructor
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: constructor(address _owner, address _feePool) public EternalStorage(_owner, _feePool) LimitedSetup(6 weeks) {}
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider making costructor payable to save gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == nominatedOwner, "You must be nominated before you can accept ownership");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == owner, "Only the contract owner may perform this action");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == associatedContract, "Only the associated contract can perform this action");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == nominatedOwner, "You must be nominated before you can accept ownership");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == owner, "Only the contract owner may perform this action");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == associatedContract, "Only the associated contract can perform this action");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(now < setupExpiryTime, "Can only perform this action during setup");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
FeePoolEternalStorage.importFeeWithdrawalData has external calls inside a loop:
	- this.setUIntValue(keccak256(bytes)(abi.encodePacked(LAST_FEE_WITHDRAWAL,accounts[i])),feePeriodIDs[i]) (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#241)

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in FeePoolEternalStorage.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#40): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#80): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#199): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (FeePoolEternalStorage.sol#222): it allows old versions
